comment:
This plugin has improved a lot lately, but is still lacking behind the VS Code equivalent.

Things to improve in version 1.5.41.9865-243-nightly:

  • No possibility to add a folder to context, feature which is available in VS Code
  • No newest models available: currently lacking GPT 4.1 (Preview) and Gemini 2.5 Pro (Preview) models which are already available in VS Code.
Will GPT 4.1 be added in a year or sooner?
What the hell is this even doing that requires multiple gigabytes of memory?
I can't even describe how bad it is
Shame that it lags behind the VSCode version but otherwise a great co developer

Version 1.5.41 is way too unstable. The code completion doesn't work at all—neither automatic nor manual triggering works. Plus, after getting disconnected, logging back in directly throws an error saying "Failed to initiate the GitHub login process. Please try again.". Come on!!!
I cannot authorize on Mac. The button "Authorize" does nothing. Also, suggested potential fixes don't work for me.
No agent mode!!
Good job, plugin is completely hosed in 1.5.41-243.
After updating to the latest version, The IDE freezes. version: 1.5.41-243
Poor, I use chatgpt instead often sometimes it helps me on a code snippet I am going to try in vscode to compare
Where is "AGENT" mode ?

Plugin is always severely behind VS Code version and can't help but think that's an intentional play by Microsoft. Here's a fun current bug: the delete key doesn't work in their chat interface. You can only use backspace to delete text. Constantly disappointing.

Dear GitHub Copilot Team,

I love using Copilot in JetBrains IDEs, but I’d like to suggest a feature to enhance the refactoring experience. When selecting a code block, right-clicking "Refactor," and choosing "Extract Method," it would be fantastic if Copilot could suggest a method name based on the code’s context, similar to how JetBrains AI Assistant works. This would streamline workflows and make naming more intuitive.

Thanks for your work!
I tried this plugin and it took up all of my RAM. I switched to Sweep AI recently, their apply is much better and faster.

Худшее говнище из всех программ что делало живое существо Предлагает дополнение которое ломает код Вставляет дубликат кода который уже у меня написан Запросы в окне чата фильтруються и баняться не показывая ответ если политике безопасности не нравиться название переменной Горячие клавиши на вставку не работают пока райдер выделил текст белой рамкой что обязывает сделать другую кучу бесполезных действий Одно хорошо, давая такой ужасный юзер экспериенс я не забуду как писать код самостоятельно
Bought CoPilot. On Windows 11 in PhpStorm it shows a button "Authorize", it does nothing. Cannot use
Is there a planned update for the Copilot agent in the IntelliJ plugin? If so, when is the release expected?
It couldn't find files I added to the context or seemed to ignore the content when it appeared to find them.
If I go to any version higher than 1.5.35-242, it causes my IntelliJ Ultimate to freeze.

WSL integration. if you are in a wslG Intellj you cannot sign in. My god it's annoying. It's not rocket science. Let the user create a token or something.

O wait they kind of have that, but it doesn't save.

What a mess. I get you want to make money, but this really sucks.

Anemic ability to apply Copilot Chat generated code with a single button click. I can replace the code at the cursor, but this limits editing to one contiguous text selection. We have invested hundreds of millions in language models, but are still hobbled by UX limitations.
Constantly breaking the editor experience! This time, all hover functionality is broken! Please start testing the code you publish, at least basic smoke tests.

The UX is terrible. The model is way behind the curve to the point where I often find myself going out of the IDE to use a different AI product (for free, when I'm paying for this!). The IDE integration is terrible, features roll out to JetBrains IDEs months after VScode, even though we pay the same price. This feels intentional even though VScode is not a replacement for fully featured IDEs and Visual Studio IDEs don't have the same support for the same languages/frameworks as JetBrains IDEs.
Theres no button to attach pictures nor can it accept pasting in a screenshot in idea
when we will gent AGENT mode???

Not as good as the AI assistant.

I have tried both. Unfortunately the company will get GitHub Copilot and not AI Assistant.

AI assistant made better suggestions in a personal project, could provide better working code examples, whereas the Copilot thing makes up random language or SDK features, which simply do not exist in the real world using Gpt4o

When it tries, it can be helpful at work, but in 95% of cases even simple tasks require 10 prompts. Despite repeated reminders not to guess and to actually look into the classes, it only skims them or ignores them, and hallucinates. It wastes my valuable time and is frustrating — not to mention the token usage, which makes me wonder if it's intentional.

Even simple CRUD tests take at least 10 prompts. You can tell me it was asked to remember to always be precise, but it ignores that every single time. Competitors are already ahead of this product. Disappointing. Slow in intellij.

It's getting better, but it's not great. The auto-complete is not that much better than what's built into the IDE, and the chat window does that annoying scroll-while-you're-reading thing. So for 'chatty' interactions I'd rather use a mature chatbot with decent UX (like ChatGPT). Also, not great keyboard-only use, and when using the inline thing (from the gutter icon) there's no way to 'accept' the suggested code (that I can see).

It worked for some time; however, after a recent upgrade, it stopped working. I tried installing the newer version (2024.3.5-Community Edition) but still failed to connect. On the same laptop, Copilot is working with Visual Studio Code.

GitHub Copilot's core functionality (code suggestions and chat) is incredibly promising and can be a significant productivity booster when it works smoothly. However, my recent experience with this version in RubyMine has been marred by significant stability and performance issues.

Based on my idea.log file analysis while troubleshooting problems like stuck indexing, very slow RuboCop execution, and incorrect syntax highlighting (e.g., for method names), the Copilot plugin appears to be a major contributing factor, if not the root cause.

Here's what I observed in the logs:

Frequent Request Cancellations: The log is flooded with JsonRpcErrorException: Request was canceled errors (error code -32800) related to com.github.copilot. While cancellations can happen, the sheer frequency suggests potential underlying issues (timeouts, internal errors?) that might be impacting IDE performance and responsiveness.

Severe UI Rendering Error: A critical SEVERE NullPointerException occurred within Java's UI rendering (sun.java2d.pipe.AlphaColorPipe related to drawing icons like RoundedIcon). The IDE explicitly logged Plugin to blame: GitHub Copilot version: 1.5.40-243 for this error. This indicates a significant bug within the plugin's UI code. UI Freezes: This severe error happened shortly after a recorded UI freeze lasting over 8 seconds, suggesting the plugin's activity might be contributing to or triggering these freezes.

Internal Errors: Other warnings like BugIndicatingError: Invalid range also appeared, pointing towards internal issues within the Copilot agent/plugin logic. Impact on IDE: The instability caused by these Copilot errors seems to directly affect core RubyMine functions. When Copilot struggles or causes freezes, background tasks like indexing appear to get stuck or corrupted, external tools like RuboCop become unresponsive within the IDE, and syntax highlighting breaks down because the IDE loses its understanding of the code structure. Troubleshooting:

Temporarily disabling the GitHub Copilot plugin seemed to alleviate the core indexing, RuboCop responsiveness, and syntax highlighting issues, further strengthening the suspicion that the plugin was the primary cause of the disruption.

I genuinely believe Copilot is a valuable tool. However, the stability issues encountered with version 1.5.40-243 in RubyMine 2024.3.5 are currently too disruptive for a smooth workflow. I strongly encourage the developers to investigate the frequent request cancellations and particularly the NullPointerException in the UI rendering code.

I look forward to future updates with improved stability so I can reliably integrate Copilot back into my daily development process.

I don't know what people are so mad about. It has code edits, like vscode. It generate files, change code, allow you to preview, accept or deny changes. You can ask for inline chat to do quick edits.

So far is great. About the quality of suggestions... well, it's a bit hit or miss, but you can see when LLM has no clue of what to do and move on to manual programming, as we always did.
Quite useful, but it feels the models are not the latest ones.
another useless shit
Suggestions are not helpful. The plugin is riddled with bug, and interfere with IDE functions.
The plugin significantly affects IDE performance in a negative way. The value provided by it is negligible, even with modern language models and latest version. Strongly NOT recommended.

The plugin has improved substantially since my last review by including features like the model selector and edits. Though feature parity has not been achieved the gap between this and the VS code extension is smaller now.

Old review (December 2024): "The plugin offers basic support for Copilot. As of now advanced features that are available in the official VS Code extension, like a model selector, are not available."
now that "code edits" is implemented it works pretty much the same as vscode. Great job!
As things stand, no programmer needs to worry about their future. A monkey given a banana makes better suggestions.
Very a need to add: .github/copilot-instructions.md for customized chat.

I have been using GitHub Copilot for some time, but after installing the latest version (1.5.40-243), it fails to initialize the connection to GitHub. While I can successfully log in to GitHub through IntelliJ's Version Control, Copilot itself is unable to authenticate when using IntelliJ or PyCharm. However, when using Visual Studio Code on the same machine, Copilot works without any issues.
Please add model selection for code completion.

At first I liked it. Then at some point it got IntelliJ to consume 40% of CPU minimum non stop, until I disabled it. Since then I enabled it again and it no longer does, but it keeps suggesting bad code, where it instanciates objects from abstract classes, or from classes with private constructor. I'm extremely disappointed for now, and management incitation to use AI coding tools might force me to move to Visual Studio Code (which I really don't want to do otherwise)

I appreciate the addition of Copilot Edits, but it seems that parity with VS Code's copilot plugin is still lacking.

For example, VS Code's Copilot Edit functionality allows a QoL enhancement to review and apply edits/diffs from a single file view/tab, using the existing opened file if present. Meanwhile, reviewing edits in JetBrain's Copilot Edit mode require me to click a button from the Working set to view the suggested changes, which then opens a new file window showing the original file and the updated file side by side. This practically results in 3 windows showing the exact same file.

I'll even decrease my rating to 1 star. Because it simply doesn't work. I need to write a bunch of repetitive code. It does not suggest anything. I create a new file, type "def foo()" and it suggests something like print("something"), good, working. I copy my code to this file, start typing - doesn't suggest. And it's not the first time it happens

It used to be great, it got worse. It randomly stops code suggestions, just shows "No suggestions" when they're obvious and would definitely be generated in the past. Sometimes it does not suggest anything until you start typing. So now it's just not reliable. I got used to its patterns and now expect it to finish a single word, and it doesn't work. So you just wait and then type it manually which is annoying. Also sometimes it's slow

I really hate having to use cursor.sh, but the copilot plugin is really no alternative. Manually copying and pasting code from the responses to the editor gets old very quick, and the new "Copilot Edits" mode is close to useless as it does not have checkpoints and does not look at the codebase automatically. Sure, LLMs are fascinating and that fascination is enough to deal with clumsy UIs for a while, but we're now entering a phase where we can expect LLM based tools to also be usable. Cursor has its own weaknesses, but it is still way way ahead of IntelliJ with the Copilot plugin.
Where is the model selector button? It's gone????
希望给Chat的输入框加入垂直滚动条，在输入内容较多时，无法对前面内容进行可视的编辑 另外在Chat中，滚动速率被调慢了，影响体验 还有语言设置，在已经设置自然语言为中文时，仍默认使用英语进行Chat 我使用的是2024.1.7版本
Apply Next Line of Complation to Edtor throw errors , My idea version is 2024.3.4.1 or 2024.3.5
